item.title: How to code hidden owner?
item.dc:creator: @warlordtt warlordtt
item.description:
@warlordtt wrote:

Player right 4 and above is hidden, and 4 is higher than 3, pretty selfexplaining.

Read full topic

item.title: How to code hidden owner?
item.dc:creator: @dragon39990 dragon39990
item.description:
@dragon39990 wrote:

Good point Lanthus. I do that too. But like gamerscape was saying about how I was wrong because player rights=4 =Hidden Admin…4>3…all i’m trying to say (hmm what if 4=SUPER OWNER…)

Read full topic

item.title: How to code hidden owner?
item.dc:creator: @Lanthus20 Lanthus20
item.description:
@Lanthus20 wrote:

[quote=“Ace., post:5, topic:335795”]Uh, tbh, I think that playerRights = 4 qualifies for Hidden Owner.

This is why:
Say, you have a command. It requires to have the player-rights of at least 3, meaning you need to be an owner. I’ll place an example of a command below:
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“alltome”) && (playerRights >= 3))
{
alltome();
}

As you may notice, it says:
&& (playerRights >= 3))
You see how it says >= 3? As you may of noticed, you need to at least have the player rights of 3, so if you have the player rights of 4, making you a ‘Hidden Administrator’/‘Hidden Owner’, you can use that command.

If you read that properly, you’ll understand what I mean by having the player-rights of 4, you can do owner commands as well.

Hopefully this all helps,
Jackson.[/quote]

that’s why I always code my owner commands to be

playerName = ("lanthus20")

Read full topic

item.title: How to code hidden owner?
item.dc:creator: @dragon39990 dragon39990
item.description:
@dragon39990 wrote:

gamerscape:

no u bell player rights 4 = hidden admin idk sorry but omfg dont be stupid…-.-

lol? lets see my friend. Is 3 bigger then 4?? NO! it’s not thats right. If you would think of it. && (playerRights >= 3)) means you need atleast player rights “3” so if 3 is owner and 4 is bigger then 3 wouldn’t you think it would be a hidden owner? and whats the point of having a hidden “ADMIN” with owner commands?

[size=20pt]ACE explained it all[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: How to code hidden owner?
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Yeah true, although I think you already have it all packed into your source anyway?
Or, Java automatically recognizes it, as I mentioned, you need to have your player rights to be set to at least 3. If you type in 4, you can use the command, you just have no crown, leaving you to be a Hidden Admin.

Read full topic

item.title: How to code hidden owner?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Ace., post:5, topic:335795”]Uh, tbh, I think that playerRights = 4 qualifies for Hidden Owner.

This is why:
Say, you have a command. It requires to have the player-rights of at least 3, meaning you need to be an owner. I’ll place an example of a command below:
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“alltome”) && (playerRights >= 3))
{
alltome();
}

As you may notice, it says:
&& (playerRights >= 3))
You see how it says >= 3? As you may of noticed, you need to at least have the player rights of 3, so if you have the player rights of 4, making you a ‘Hidden Administrator’/‘Hidden Owner’, you can use that command.

If you read that properly, you’ll understand what I mean by having the player-rights of 4, you can do owner commands as well.

Hopefully this all helps,
Jackson.[/quote]

He may also have to add it to the client. Otherwise you’ll have to add some sloppy work around methods to the server using more specifics, like names, IPs, etc.

Read full topic
